content: this legal case was filed in the municipal civil court in zagreb and involves a dispute over coownership of several properties the procedure started in 2002 and lasted for 18 years and 6 months the final resolution was that the plaintiff became the sole owner of six properties while the defendant was ordered to compensate the plaintiff for their market value the court determined the ownership of specific areas within the properties for each party the plaintiff was also ordered to pay the defendant a compensation amount within 15 days the court based its decision on the property act and allowed for a geometric division of the properties without significantly reducing their value the plaintiff had constructed a house on the land and created new land registry parcels the court found that the plaintiff had a legal interest in terminating the coownership and approved their request however the judgment was later remanded for retrial due to an appeal citing a substantial violation of procedural rules
